text: <@U026PT0D7>: regarding kegerator proposal - does the recommend only have one keg/one tap?
the recommended budget is a "mini-fridge" sized kegerator with 3 taps on a single tower
The fridge can hold (1) half-barrel keg (this is a "full size" keg, 15.5gal), or combinations of smaller kegs. It could hold (3) 1/6th-barrel kegs
whats a normal price-effective purchase for a keg? didn't realize there were so many keg variants
(although in that last case at least one of the kegs would have to be "homebrew" style, or Corny. This kegerator cannot fit (3) 1/6th-barrel Sankey kegs)
cause if its always a normal keg, and that's the right scale for the size events we hold, or whatever, then i would think we want to assume we were using full size kegs.

in terms of a half-barrel keg, I saw a few kegerators that would fit multiple kegs. They start at $2250 though.
But if it's a short-term scale (ie ordering multiple kegs for one event), we could keep one keg in the fridge and the rest in the open or in an ice-tub.
